name: Katy Perry
description:
'''Katheryn Elizabeth Hudson''' (born October 25, 1984), known professionally as '''Katy Perry''', is an American singer, songwriter, and television personality. She is known for her influence on [[pop music]] and her [[Camp (style)|camp]] style, being dubbed the "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Queen of Camp]]" by [[Vogue (magazine)|''Vogue'']] and ''[[Rolling Stone]]''.

At 16, Perry released a [[gospel music|gospel]] album titled ''[[Katy Hudson (album)|Katy Hudson]]'' (2001) under [[Pamplin Music|Red Hill Records]], which was unsuccessful. She moved to Los Angeles at 17, adopting her stage name from her mother's maiden name. Following a series of professional setbacks, Perry signed to [[Capitol Records]] and rose to fame with the [[pop rock]] album ''[[One of the Boys]]'' (2008). Its singles, "[[I Kissed a Girl]]" and "[[Hot n Cold]]", reached number one and three on the U.S. [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] respectively. Perry's [[disco]]-influenced pop record ''[[Teenage Dream]]'' (2010) became the only album by a female artist to spawn five U.S. number-one singles: "[[California Gurls]]", "[[Teenage Dream (Katy Perry song)|Teenage Dream]]", "[[Firework (song)|Firework]]", "[[E.T. (song)|E.T.]]", and "[[Last Friday Night (T.G.I.F.)]]". Its reissue, subtitled ''[[Teenage Dream: The Complete Confection|The Complete Confection]]'' (2012), produced another U.S. number-one single "[[Part of Me (Katy Perry song)|Part of Me]]". The [[dance music|dance]]-inspired ''[[Prism (Katy Perry album)|Prism]]'' (2013) yielded two U.S. number-one singles, "[[Roar (song)|Roar]]" and "[[Dark Horse (Katy Perry song)|Dark Horse]]". She remains musically active, and has since released three more albums; ''[[Witness (Katy Perry album)|Witness]]'' (2017), ''[[Smile (Katy Perry album)|Smile]]'' (2020), and ''[[143 (Katy Perry album)|143]]'' (2024).

Perry is one of the [[List of best-selling music artists|best-selling music artists in history]], having sold over 151 million records worldwide. Six of her songs have received Diamond certifications from the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). The [[Forbes list of the world's highest-paid musicians#Female|world's highest-paid female musician]] in 2015 and 2018, she was named by [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']] as one of the [[Billboard's Greatest Pop Stars#21st century|greatest pop stars of the 21st century]]. [[List of awards and nominations received by Katy Perry|Her accolades]] include a [[Billboard Spotlight Award|''Billboard'' Spotlight Award]], 20 ''[[Guinness World Records]]'', five [[Billboard Music Award|''Billboard'' Music Awards]], five [[American Music Awards]], a [[Brit Award]], a [[Juno Award]], and seven [[MTV Video Music Awards]] (including the [[Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award]]). Perry was the first artist to have multiple videos reach one billion views on [[Vevo]] and [[YouTube]], with "Roar" and "Dark Horse". With an estimated net worth of $360 million, she is [[List of music artists by net worth|among the world's wealthiest musicians]].

Outside of music, Perry released an autobiographical documentary titled ''[[Katy Perry: Part of Me]]'' in 2012, voiced [[Smurfette]] in ''[[The Smurfs]]'' film series (2011â€“2013) and launched her own shoe line [[Katy Perry Collections]] in 2017. She served as a judge on ''[[American Idol]]'' from the [[American Idol season 16|sixteenth season]] in 2018 to the [[American Idol season 22|twenty-second season]] in 2024. In 2025, Perry flew into space aboard [[Blue Origin NS-31]], the first all-female space flight since 1963, which received significant media coverage. She is an advocate for [[LGBT rights]] and [[women's rights]], and was named a [[List of UNICEF Goodwill Ambassadors|UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador]] in 2013. Her philanthropy and activism focus on children's education and [[HIV/AIDS]] awereness.
